### Problem

```
Crashed Thread:        0  Dispatch queue: com.apple.main-thread

Exception Type:        EXC_BAD_ACCESS (SIGSEGV)
Exception Codes:       KERN_INVALID_ADDRESS at 0xea6a938704720040 -> 0x0000138704720040 (possible pointer authentication failure)
Exception Codes:       0x0000000000000001, 0xea6a938704720040

Termination Reason:    Namespace SIGNAL, Code 11 Segmentation fault: 11

--->  GAP OF 0x5f9000000000 BYTES
      MALLOC_NANO              600000000000-600020000000 [512.0M] rw-/rwx SM=PRV  

Thread 0 Crashed::  Dispatch queue: com.apple.main-thread
0   libsystem_platform.dylib      	       0x1884f8dc4 _platform_strlen + 4
1   nvim                          	       0x102b4aa8c get_sign_display_info + 756
2   nvim                          	       0x102b44754 win_line + 5136
3   nvim                          	       0x102b50f90 win_update + 5848
4   nvim                          	       0x102b4f274 update_screen + 8356
5   nvim                          	       0x102ced510 normal_check.llvm.1043498901407137291 + 1556
6   nvim                          	       0x102dea228 state_enter + 108
7   nvim                          	       0x102c716a0 main + 16612
8   dyld                          	       0x1881510e0 start + 2360
```

### Steps to reproduce

1) Add to config:
```
signcolumn = "auto:2-9",
```

```
vim.diagnostic.config {
    signs = true,
    virtual_text = false,
    underline = true,
    severity_sort = true,
    float = {
      focusable = false,
      style = "minimal",
      source = "always",
      header = "",
      prefix = "",
    },
  }
```

2) Setup `lspconfig.rust_analyzer`

3) Create Rust file with content

```
trait Tr {}
struct S<T: Tr> {
    list: Vec<T>,
}

pub trait Test {
    type T: Tr;

    fn test(&mut self) -> &mut S<Self::T>;
}
```

4) Move cursor to:
```
fn test(&mut self) -> &mut S<Self::T>;
                       ^
```


5) Press `x`.

### Expected behavior

No crash

### Neovim version (nvim -v)

NVIM v0.10.0-dev-1813+g8097b4a72-Homebrew

### Vim (not Nvim) behaves the same?

no

### Operating system/version

macOS 14

### Terminal name/version

Alacritty

### $TERM environment variable

xterm-256color

### Installation

brew

comment_data.body:
In this case also work with:

```lua
signcolumn = "auto:4", -- 4 or greater
```

or

```lua
signcolumn = "yes:4", -- 4 or greater
```


-----
**Update**

In other cases, the crash remains

```
:set signcolumn=yes:1 # print 1 sign column
:set signcolumn=yes:2 # print all signs (not fixed size)
```
